alert.note: Alert for Carter (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 8:52AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southeast Oklahoma, Johnston. In southern Oklahoma, Carter and Murray. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Turner Falls. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Turner Falls is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sulphur, Davis, Springer, Dougherty, Gene Autry, Turner Falls, Lake Of The Arbuckles, Milo and Hennepin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
